column4: hey guys,.,. i have another ubuntu os on a diff HD,. evertime i go to browse this drive through nautilus it asks for my password,.,. anyway to stop this?
/etc/fstab is a file that describes the filesystems to automatically mount
are you using Nautilus? shows up fine in mine
wot exactly to u press on?
Places -> Computer -> File System -> etc -> fstab
kk hang on
it definitely shows up there
its a screen shot of my files
bleh I'm behind a router, DCC doesn't work for me at all
me neither,.,.lol
but point is, /etc/fstab should be viewable in Nautilus :)
nope,.,. where online can i put this picture,. so i can show u?
imageshack will do
url?
http://imageshack.us/
: http://img254.imageshack.us/my.php?image=screenshotfv6.png
look down, fstab is a file :)
oopsy,.,. i thought it was a folder,.,. my bad
not really, defragmentation on Linux is not really necessary

ardchoille, bkar, danbhfive, i just wanted to see wot it looks like,.,. wow,.,. u no the graphical pics of how fraged ur drive is,,.,. i wanted to see how much better ubuntu was,.,. no need to shout,.,.lol
we're not
i no,.,. it was the loadsa people going no! it was just funny
